body_content.explanation: A tall deciduous tree (= one that loses its leaves in autumn) from eastern North America, with leaves that have a central stem with small leaves arranged on either side of it, hard wood, and usually thorns (= sharp points) on its branches :
examples: Black walnut and honey locusts could be planted along roads to absorb pollutants.
We have a lot of honey locust and honeysuckle at the edge of the river.
They ate under the shade of a honey locust tree.
